page.title: 07DEVIL'S DITCH NEAR ANDOVER
page.content:
Little can be seen today but, to judge from the section exposed by the railway cutting which runs across it, the{Devil's Ditch}near Andover could have been as much as nine feet deep.
Although no more than 800m long on the map, it is claimed to be traceable from{Chute Hill,}seven miles to the north-west, down through nearby {Harewood Forest,}and even as far as the{River Test}over four miles to the south.
The function of the ditch remains a mystery, but it may well have been nothing more sinister than an early {boundary dyke,}marking the land of a local tribe !
